---
title: "Tutorial on Setting up Github access on your own computer"
format: html
editor: visual
---

1.  log into your github account

2.  Navigate to my Github page, for example, https://github.com/lewangecon/stat22 (or whatever the course page link is).

3.  Click **Fork** ![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/AyR5Ag0kwNGH6TfOHf6q-zxi9JbgdXtRi9r7gr_dFLk.original.fullsize.png)

4.  Click **Code** and copy and paste the HTTPS url.

![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/XHa6c_GykJf92GcViZmQFwQPiDxyGQyTaAzifkDWcbQ.original.fullsize.png)

4.  Rstudio, click **File** **\>** **New Project**,

5.  Select **Version Control**

    ![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/dQ-OKac0n5LkNAK1yUC1tQwXedT9sqSODhboZamHQQA.original.fullsize.png)

6.  Click **Git**

    ![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/49L6msv3vNIEhQxwQN76Vz2np6nVlY1W18x1XnqAQDY.original.fullsize.png)

7.  Copy and paste the HTTPS url in the prompt **Repository URL**

    ![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/Df0KpClg8xNU71lAULYrU_J68iALSZFt8eX85Ad4UZ4.original.fullsize.png)

8.  Create a new project, and Done!

    ![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/snip/images/M-z5zxcf3qwOTtprnIP6xf4XxxG9prgn8-Qk3m_R8bg.original.fullsize.png)
